Mechanical Engineering (Bachelor of Engi.htmlRequirements:
Year 1
  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • CHEM150 - Engineering Chemistry (1.5)
      • CSC111 - Fundamentals of Programming with Engineering Applications (1.5)
      • ENGR110 - Design and Communication I (2.5)
      • ENGR120 - Design and Communication II (2.5)
      • ENGR130 - Introduction to Professional Practice (0.5)
      • ENGR141 - Engineering Mechanics (1.5)
    • Complete 1 of:
      • MATH100 - Calculus I (1.5)
      • MATH109 - Introduction to Calculus (1.5)
    • Complete all of:
      • MATH101 - Calculus II (1.5)
      • MATH110 - Matrix Algebra for Engineers (1.5)
    • Complete all of:
      • PHYS110 - Introductory Physics I (1.5)
      • PHYS111 - Introductory Physics II (1.5)
Note
  • CSC 115 may be accepted as a substitute for CSC 116; see Mechanical Engineering for approval
Year 2
  • Complete all of:
    • CSC116 - Fundamentals of Programming with Engineering Applications II (1.5)
    • ECE216 - Electricity and Magnetism (1.5)
    • ECE250 - Linear Circuits I (1.5)
    • ENGR297 - Technology and Society (1.5)
    • MATH200 - Calculus III (1.5)
    • MATH204 - Calculus IV (1.5)
    • MECH200 - Engineering Drawing, CAD and Manufacturing (1.5)
    • MECH220 - Mechanics of Solids I (1.5)
    • MECH240 - Thermodynamics (1.5)
    • MECH242 - Dynamics (1.5)
    • MECH285 - Properties of Engineering Materials (1.5)
    • STAT254 - Probability and Statistics for Engineers (1.5)
Year 3
  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • CSC349A - Numerical Analysis (1.5)
      • ECE365 - Applied Electronics and Electrical Machines (1.5)
      • ECON180 - Introduction to Economics and Financial Project Evaluation (1.5)
      • MECH330 - Introduction to Mechanical Vibrations (1.5)
      • MECH335 - Theory of Mechanisms (1.5)
      • MECH345 - Mechanics of Fluids (1.5)
      • MECH350 - Engineering Design (1.5)
      • MECH360 - Design of Mechanical Elements (1.5)
      • MECH380 - Automatic Control Engineering (1.5)
      • MECH395 - Heat Transfer (1.5)
    • Complete 3 units from:
      • MECH320 - Mechanics of Solids II (1.5)
      • MECH342 - Dynamics II (1.5)
      • MECH381 - Control Systems II (1.5)
      • MECH390 - Energy Conversion (1.5)

Year 4
  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • ENGR446 - Technical Report (1.0)
      • ENGR498 - Engineering Law (1.5)
      • MECH400 - Capstone Design Project (3.0)
    • Complete 1 of the following
      • Complete 1.5 units of:
        Complementary Studies Electives (deals with central issues in humanities or social sciences, as required by CEAB guidelines for complementary studies, and as approved by the BEng Programs Committee. A current list of acceptable replacement courses is available from the Engineering Undergraduate Office (EUO).)
      • Complete all of:
        • MECH462 - Small Business Startup and Organization (1.5)
    • Complete 3 units from:
      • MECH410 - Computer-Aided Design and Engineering (1.5)
      • MECH442 - Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (1.5)
      • MECH455 - Instrumentation (1.5)
      • MECH458 - Mechatronics (1.5)
      • MECH460 - Computer-Aided Manufacturing (1.5)
      • MECH475 - Aircraft Design (1.5)
      • MECH493 - Design of Thermo-Fluid Systems (1.5)
    • Complete 9 units of:
      Technical Electives not used for other program requirements

Year 3

Year 4

    • Complete 3 units from ASTR BCMB, BIOC, BIOL, CHEM, CSC, EOS, MATH, MEDS, MICR, MRNE, PHYS, SENG, or STAT 400 - 499
    • Complete 3 units from ASTR BCMB, BIOC, BIOL, CHEM, CSC, EOS, MATH, MEDS, MICR, MRNE, PHYS, SENG, or STAT 100 - 499

Complete all of the following: This list is the Fine Arts co-requisite; this is a Faculty of Fine Arts requirement. See note below.

year-2: Upon acceptance to the School of Music, students will also be required to pass a theory entrance exam covering rudimentary skills. Students who do not pass this exam will be required to take MUS 111 as a music elective prior to advancing to MUS 101A the following year.
Students who have not yet satisfied the academic writing requirement (AWR) should take ATWP 135, ENGL 146, or ENGL 147 as a non-music elective (1.5 units) early on in the degree.
Students wishing to major in Music Education must register in MUS 131 which replaces the non-music elective.
Students wishing to major in Composition must register in MUS 105 which replaces the non-music elective.

Composition and Theory (Bachelor of Musi.htmlRequirements:
Year 1
  • Complete all of the following
    • Complete all of:
      • MUS101A - Language of Music (1.5)
      • MUS101B - Language of Music (1.5)
      • MUS116 - Music Appreciation (1.5)
      • MUS121 - Western Music from Antiquity to 1750 (1.5)
      • MUS170A - Basic Musicianship IA (1.0)
      • MUS170B - Basic Musicianship IB (1.0)
      • MUS181 - Chamber Music (1.0)
    • Complete 2.0 units from:
      • MUS140 - Individual Tuition (1.0)
    • Complete 2.0 units from:
      • MUS180A - University Orchestra (1.0)
      • MUS180B - University Wind Symphony (1.0)
      • MUS180C - University Concert Band (1.0)
      • MUS180D - Jazz and Creative Music Ensemble (1.0)
      • MUS180E - University Chorus (1.0)
      • MUS180F - Chamber Singers (1.0)
      • MUS180G - University Women's Choir (1.0)
    • Complete all of the following
      • Complete 1 of:
        • AHVS120 - Exploring World Art (1.5)
        • AHVS121 - Understanding Visual Communication (1.5)
        • ART150 - Introduction to Contemporary Art Theory, Criticism and Practice (1.5)
        • ART151 - An Introduction to Contemporary Visual Art (1.5)
        • FA101 - Creative Being (1.5)
        • FA245 - The Arts and Technology I (1.5 - 3)
        • THEA102 - Theatre Appreciation from Page to Stage (1.5)
        • THEA111 - Theatre History I (1.5)
        • WRIT109 - The Writer's World in Books and Film (1.5)
        • WRIT120 - Writing for the Arts (1.5)
      • This list is the Fine Arts co-requisite; this is a Faculty of Fine Arts requirement. See note below.
    • Complete 1.5 units of:
      Non-music elective
Notes
  • Upon acceptance to the School of Music, students will also be required to pass a theory entrance exam covering rudimentary skills. Students who do not pass this exam will be required to take MUS 111 as a music elective prior to advancing to MUS 101A the following year.
  • Students who have not yet satisfied the academic writing requirement (AWR) should take ATWP 135, ENGL 146, or ENGL 147 as a non-music elective (1.5 units) early on in the degree.
  • Students wishing to major in Music Education must register in MUS 131 which replaces the non-music elective.
  • Students wishing to major in Composition must register in MUS 105 which replaces the non-music elective.

Complete all of the following: Complete 6 units from BIOL or MRNE  300 - 499
